org.sd.text
Class StringAligner

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.StringAligner

public class StringAligner
extends java.lang.Object

Utility to align two strings if possible.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

StringAligner

public StringAligner(java.lang.String base,
                     java.lang.String candidate)
Method Detail

aligns

public boolean aligns()
Get whether the base aligns with the candidate.

Alignment means that all letters from base or candidate are matched in order to the other; potentially with skipped letters (see penalty).

getAlignment

public StringAligner.Alignment getAlignment()
Get the alignment or null.

getPenalty

public int getPenalty()
Get the alignment penalty.

0 means perfect alignment (essentially equals); -1 means no alignment; 1+ counts the number of "skipped" chars while aligning.

getMatchedCandidateString

public java.lang.String getMatchedCandidateString()
Get the portion of the candidate string that matched the base.

getPostMatchedCandidateString

public java.lang.String getPostMatchedCandidateString()
Get the portion of the candidate string after the match to the base.

getPreMatchedCandidateString

public java.lang.String getPreMatchedCandidateString()
Get the portion of the candidate string before the match to the base.

getMatchedSegment

public java.lang.String getMatchedSegment(BreakStrategy breakStrategy)
Get the segment of the candidate string starting from where the base starts matching and ending at the first HARD break, but only if the segment starts after a break.

Parameters:
breakStrategy - The breakStrategy to use; if null, a GeneralBreakStrategy will be used.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
